page.title: 02Upottery Village 2
page.content: There has been a number of changes to the village and, according to a local newspaper of 1955 much of the village was{rebuilt in the 1800s.}The coach house across from the pub was probably the stables for the Manor which was also rebuilt at that time. A gatehouse and iron gates can also still be seen. Some houses were not altered such as the thatched house near the church and the war memorial. The house is particularly interesting as it has a set of double doors where the village fire brigade kept a sort of fire engine which they operated by hand. Other important buildings are the {church of St.Mary}and the{County {Primary School},a stone construction built in 1877 when the former bulding became the Justice Room.
